name: 王柄雄
objective: This course is aimed to provide an essential knowledge about the mechanical behavior and design of critical members of a building frame. Main focus will be placed on beam, column, and beam-column joint for their flexure, shear, bond, and anchorage behaviors. Besides, state-of-the-art research about the deteriorated hysteresis behavior and damage evaluation of reinforced concrete columns will be presented.
schedule:
Major Topics include:
1.　　Design concepts of reinforced concrete members
2.　　Reinforced concrete material properties and quality controls
3.　　Mechanical behavior of reinforced concrete
4.　　Confined concrete models and axial compression tests
5.　　Fundamentals of beam flexure
6.　　Moment curvature analysis and software demonstration
7.　　Concentrated plasticity approach for deflection calculations
8.　　Shear transfer mechanism and shear design
9.　　Bond and anchorage design
10.　　Cross-sectional analysis of columns and biaxial bending
11.　　Seismic response of structures
12.　　Seismic design and consideration of building frames
13.　　Behavior and design of beam-column joints
14.　　Cyclic behavior and analytical methods for RC columns
15.　　Deteriorated hysteresis behavior of RC columns
16.　　Damage evaluation of RC columns
scorePolicy:
Attendance & Interaction 20%
Homework 20%
Midterm exam 30%
Final exam 30%
materials:
Paulay, T., and Priestley, M.J.N., Seismic Design of Reinforced Concrete and Masonry Buildings, John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1992.
ACI Committee 318, Building Code Requirement for Structural Concrete (ACI 318-19) and Commentary (ACI 318R-19), American Concrete Institute, 623 pp., 2019.
